glsa.title: NVIDIA binary graphics driver: Privilege escalation vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: The NVIDIA binary graphics driver is vulnerable to a local privilege escalation through an X session.

background.p: The NVIDIA binary graphics driver from NVIDIA Corporation provides the kernel module and the GL modules for graphic acceleration on the NVIDIA based graphic cards.

description.p: Rapid7 reported a boundary error in the NVIDIA binary graphics driver that leads to a buffer overflow in the accelerated rendering functionality.

impact.p: An X client could trigger the buffer overflow with a maliciously crafted series of glyphs. A remote attacker could also entice a user to open a specially crafted web page, document or X client that will trigger the buffer overflow. This could result in the execution of arbitrary code with root privileges or at least in the crash of the X server.

workaround.p: Disable the accelerated rendering functionality in the Device section of xorg.conf :
